channel.title: Getting the OS's date format
channel.description:
Wanted to share this as I found it very handy but spend some time figuring out how to do it. This formats date and/or time to the format that is used on the OS where the program is running on.
[code=java] Locale locale = new Locale(System.getProperty("user.language")); String formattedDate = DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.MEDIUM, locale).format(new Date()); String formattedTime = DateFormat.getTimeInstance(DateFormat.MEDIUM, locale).format(new Date()); System.out.println(formattedDate + " " + formattedTime); [/code]
[i]Example output for French:[/i] [code]10 sept. 2014 22:49:05[/code]
[i]Example output for English:[/i] [code]Sep 10, 2014 10:49:05 PM[/code]
You can of course also provide the format you want instead of the one used by the OS. The locale class has some constants for it.
